title: An Old Box of Films, Part 2
body:
So, here's what we've learned so far:

  • THE DREAMER is none other than Dreamer, a Rocky-style bowling movie, as Jeff pointed out on the first post. Strangely enough, DREAMER was never released theatrically... it went straight to video. So then why do we have a pristine 35mm print of the film? And more importantly, would a bowling movie from 1979 play well at The Moxie?

  • The STAR WARS trailer is actually a promo for the April 10, 1981 re-release (just before THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK was released). I was hoping it was an original from 76 or 77, but still... a 25 year old STAR WARS preview is pretty cool.

  • I'm still waiting to hear back from 20th Century Fox on DAMNATION ALLEY (regarding whether it's the last remaining print, etc.).

  • Springfield 33, our local ABC affiliate, will be running a story about the films tomorrow during the 5:00 news, and possibly again during the 10:00.

Very exciting stuff! As usual, I'll keep updating as I learn more.
author: Dan

comments.author: Matthew Martin aka Master RJ
comments.body:
Leonard Maltin on Dreamer (1979) from Leonard Maltin's 2007 Movie Guide:

Bowling, a sport only slightly more cinematic than isometric exercises, gets the Rocky treatment in this bland rags-to-riches story. Having Tim Matheson's bowling ball made by Flubber might have helped pick up the pace.

In short, Maltin gave it two stars. Fox might be wondering on the print of the film (I read it was a Fox release and the film is only available on VHS). Also, a bowling film will do well, remember The Big Lebowski?

comments.author: J.D.
comments.body:
It's great that you got these movies, but I was wondering if there was anything that would prevent you from showing them.
Ya know except for them not doing good, like do you need to get the studio's permission or anything or can you just show them?

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: The Big Lebowski was anything but a bowling movie. The best summarization would include flying nude female painters and White Russians. But NOT bowling.

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
caleb is correct.. rj is not... but you guys knew that

i was born in 79 and im pretty sure i would play well at the moxie

comments.author: --Jeff
comments.body:
Agreed: The Big Lebowski is NOT a bowling movie.

Kingpin: Best bowling movie ever.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Don't play it on a Saturday.  I don't roll on Saturday.

comments.author: Matthew Martin aka Master RJ
comments.body: The Big Lebowski IS a bowling movie. That's like saying Vision Quest isn't a wrestling movie.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: I think what Caleb means is that The Big Lebowski has bowling in it, but that is not why it did well.

comments.author: Matthew Martin aka Master RJ
comments.body: I was just trying to spread good cheer, tootles.

comments.author: tim
comments.body: Odd, i don't read this site for a couple days and my co-worker tells me about this little theater from my home town he saw on CBS nightly news and how they received a gift of a bunch of old film prints. Imagine if the Moxie was that theater, crazy.
